definitions: glass or plastic container filled with water for keeping fish and aquatic plants
public building containing tanks for displaying aquatic animals and plants to visitors
examples: The tropical fish swam gracefully in the home aquarium
She cleaned the aquarium filter every two weeks religiously
The city aquarium attracts millions of visitors each year
Children pressed against the aquarium glass watching sharks swim

definitions: plant or animal that lives primarily in water environments
activities or exercises performed in water, especially for fitness
examples: The pond contained various aquatics including water lilies and reeds
Marine aquatics require specific salinity levels to thrive properly
She enrolled in aquatics classes at the community pool
The rehabilitation center offered therapeutic aquatics for injured athletes

definitions: artificial channel or bridge-like structure built to transport water across long distances
examples: The Roman aqueduct still carries water after two thousand years
Engineers designed the aqueduct to supply the growing desert city

definitions: person appointed to settle disputes between parties outside of court
person whose judgment or opinion is considered authoritative in a particular area
examples: The arbiter ruled in favor of the plaintiff after reviewing evidence
Both parties agreed to accept the arbiter's decision as final
Fashion magazines often serve as arbiters of style and taste
Critics became the arbiters of what constituted serious literature

definitions: legal process where disputes are resolved by an impartial third party outside court
examples: The labor dispute went to arbitration after negotiations failed completely
International arbitration resolved the complex cross-border commercial conflict successfully

definitions: qualified person appointed to resolve disputes between parties through arbitration proceedings
examples: The arbitrator listened carefully to both sides before making decisions
They selected an experienced arbitrator specializing in employment law matters

definitions: shaded garden shelter formed by trees or climbing plants on a framework
rotating shaft or spindle in machinery that holds cutting tools or workpieces
examples: The wedding ceremony took place under a rose-covered arbor beautifully
They built a wooden arbor to support the growing grape vines
The machinist replaced the damaged arbor in the milling machine
The saw arbor needed adjustment to eliminate unwanted blade wobble

definitions: segment of a circle or any smooth curve
luminous electrical discharge between two electrodes through a gas
narrative trajectory showing character or plot development over time
examples: The rainbow formed a perfect arc across the evening sky
The ball followed a high arc before landing in the basket
The welder wore protective gear against the dangerous electrical arc
An arc formed between the two terminals causing a bright flash
The character's redemption arc spanned all three seasons perfectly
Her career arc went from intern to CEO impressively

definitions: covered passageway with shops along one or both sides
entertainment venue containing coin-operated games and amusement machines
series of arches supported by columns as an architectural element
examples: Shoppers strolled through the Victorian arcade admiring window displays
The Burlington Arcade features luxury boutiques and jewelers exclusively
Teenagers spent their allowance at the video game arcade downtown
The arcade's newest pinball machine attracted crowds of players
The monastery's arcade provided shelter for walking meditation daily
Gothic arcades lined both sides of the ancient cloister

definitions: curved structure spanning an opening, typically supporting weight from above
curved part of the foot between the heel and toes
prefix meaning chief, principal, or most important
examples: The stone arch bridge has stood for over five centuries
Workers carefully constructed the arch using a temporary wooden support
Her high arches made finding comfortable shoes particularly difficult
The podiatrist recommended exercises to strengthen his fallen arches
The arch villain appeared in the final scene dramatically
He became the arch rival of the defending champion

definitions: scientist who studies human history through excavation and analysis of artifacts and remains
examples: The archaeologist carefully brushed dirt from the ancient pottery fragment
Archaeologists discovered evidence of a previously unknown civilization there

definitions: scientific study of human history through excavation of sites and analysis of artifacts
examples: Modern archaeology uses advanced technology like ground-penetrating radar extensively
She earned her doctorate in archaeology specializing in Mayan civilizations

definitions: high-ranking Christian bishop who oversees other bishops in a geographical province
examples: The archbishop presided over the ordination ceremony of new priests
Canterbury's archbishop leads the Church of England as primate

definitions: person who shoots arrows with a bow for sport, hunting, or combat
examples: The archer drew her bow and aimed at the distant target
Medieval archers played crucial roles in many historical battles

definitions: sport or practice of shooting arrows with a bow at targets
examples: She practiced archery every weekend at the local range
Olympic archery requires incredible precision and mental focus

definitions: original model or pattern from which copies are made or derived
universally recognized symbol or character type recurring across cultures and literature
examples: The building became the archetype for modern skyscraper design
This software serves as the archetype for user-friendly interfaces
The wise mentor represents a common archetype in storytelling
Jung identified the shadow as a fundamental psychological archetype

definitions: group or chain of islands clustered together in a sea or ocean
examples: The Indonesian archipelago contains over seventeen thousand islands total
They sailed through the archipelago exploring each inhabited island

definitions: professional who designs buildings and oversees their construction
person who creates or devises a plan, system, or structure
examples: The architect presented blueprints for the new museum design
Frank Lloyd Wright remains America's most celebrated architect historically
She was the chief architect of the company's expansion strategy
The senator became the architect of major healthcare reform

definitions: art and science of designing and constructing buildings and structures
complex structure or organization of a system or network
examples: Gothic architecture features pointed arches and flying buttresses prominently
She studied architecture at the prestigious design school abroad
The software architecture allows for easy scalability and maintenance
Scientists mapped the complex architecture of the human brain

definitions: collection of historical documents or records providing information about a place or group
place where historical documents and records are stored
computer storage area for data that is no longer actively used
examples: Researchers found valuable letters in the university's historical archive
The archive contains newspapers dating back two hundred years
The national archive houses millions of government documents securely
Climate-controlled rooms in the archive preserve delicate manuscripts
The system automatically moves old emails to the archive folder
They retrieved the data from the backup archive successfully

definitions: professional who maintains and manages collections of historical documents and records
examples: The archivist cataloged newly donated letters from the Civil War
Museum archivists ensure proper preservation of fragile historical documents

definitions: passage or entrance formed by an arch, especially through a wall
examples: Guests entered the garden through a stone archway covered in ivy
The archway between rooms created an open, flowing floor plan

definitions: region around the North Pole, including the Arctic Ocean and surrounding land
extremely cold conditions or weather characteristic of polar regions
examples: Climate change dramatically affects wildlife in the Arctic region
The expedition explored uncharted areas of the Canadian Arctic
Arctic temperatures made outdoor work nearly impossible this winter
She wore arctic gear designed for extreme cold conditions

definitions: intense enthusiasm, passion, or devotion toward a person, cause, or activity
examples: His ardor for social justice inspired countless young activists
She pursued her scientific research with remarkable ardor and dedication

definitions: particular part of a place, region, country, or the world
subject or range of activity, interest, or expertise
extent of a two-dimensional surface within a boundary
examples: The residential area features tree-lined streets and parks
Police cordoned off the area surrounding the crime scene
Her area of expertise includes molecular biology and genetics
The company expanded into new areas of business development
Calculate the area of the rectangle using length times width
The total area of the property measures five thousand square feet

definitions: large enclosed area for sports events, concerts, or other entertainment
sphere of interest, activity, or competition in a particular field
examples: Twenty thousand fans packed the arena for the championship game
The new arena features state-of-the-art sound and lighting systems
She entered the political arena after years in journalism
Companies compete fiercely in the global technology arena

definitions: heated discussion or disagreement between people with different views
systematic reasoning or series of statements to support a position
value or expression passed to a function or procedure in programming
examples: Their argument about finances lasted well into the night
The siblings had frequent arguments over trivial matters
The lawyer presented a compelling argument for her client's innocence
His argument relied on three key pieces of evidence
The function requires two arguments to calculate the result
Pass the filename as the first argument to the script

definitions: systematic process of constructing and presenting reasons to support conclusions or positions
examples: Strong argumentation requires both logic and supporting evidence clearly
The essay demonstrated excellent argumentation throughout all three sections

definitions: state of being extremely dry, especially due to lack of rainfall
examples: The region's aridity makes agriculture challenging without extensive irrigation
Increasing aridity threatens water supplies in many developing nations

definitions: highest social class in certain societies, typically holding hereditary titles
group regarded as superior in a particular sphere or activity
examples: The French aristocracy lost power during the Revolution dramatically
Members of the aristocracy owned vast estates throughout England
Silicon Valley has created a new aristocracy of tech billionaires
The literary aristocracy gathered at exclusive salon meetings

definitions: member of the aristocracy, especially someone with a hereditary title
examples: The aristocrat donated her family's art collection to the museum
British aristocrats traditionally sent their children to elite boarding schools

definitions: branch of mathematics dealing with basic operations like addition and subtraction
use of numbers and calculations in solving practical problems
examples: Children learn arithmetic before advancing to algebra and geometry
The arithmetic curriculum covers multiplication tables and long division
Simple arithmetic shows the budget won't balance this quarter
Her mental arithmetic impressed everyone at the meeting

definitions: large boat built by Noah in the Bible to save animals from the flood
chest or container holding sacred Jewish scrolls or covenant tablets
examples: Noah's ark carried two of every animal during the great flood
Children's books often depict the ark filled with animal pairs
The ark containing the Torah scrolls stands in the synagogue
The Ark of the Covenant held the stone tablets

definitions: upper limb of the human body from shoulder to hand
branch of military service or type of weapon
projecting part of a machine, chair, or other structure
examples: She broke her arm falling from the climbing wall
The nurse drew blood from his left arm carefully
The infantry arm coordinated with air support during operations
Nations raced to develop their nuclear arms capabilities
The crane's mechanical arm lifted heavy containers effortlessly
He rested his book on the chair's padded arm

definitions: large fleet of warships, especially the Spanish fleet defeated in 1588
examples: The Spanish Armada sailed to invade England in fifteen eighty-eight
An armada of fishing vessels headed out to sea

definitions: small mammal with a protective shell of bony plates, native to the Americas
examples: The armadillo rolled into a ball when threatened by predators
Armadillos dig burrows and feed mainly on insects and grubs

definitions: military weapons and equipment, especially of a particular country or military force
examples: The nation increased armament production during the military buildup
Heavy armament includes tanks, artillery, and missile systems

definitions: band worn around the upper arm for decoration or support
band worn on the arm to indicate rank, membership, or mourning
examples: Athletes wore compression armbands to support their muscles
She wore a decorative armband with her evening dress
Security personnel wore bright yellow armbands for identification
Players wore black armbands to honor the deceased teammate

definitions: comfortable chair with side supports for the arms, typically upholstered
examples: Grandfather dozed in his favorite leather armchair after dinner
She curled up in the armchair with her mystery novel

definitions: formal agreement between warring parties to stop fighting, typically while negotiating peace
examples: The armistice ended World War One on November eleventh
Both sides violated the armistice within days of signing

definitions: protective covering worn by warriors or soldiers to prevent injury in battle
protective metal plating on military vehicles, ships, or aircraft
examples: Medieval knights wore heavy armor weighing up to sixty pounds
The museum displayed samurai armor from sixteenth century Japan
Tank armor can withstand direct hits from most conventional weapons
The ship's armor plating protected vital areas from enemy fire

definitions: place where weapons and military equipment are stored
building used for military training and as headquarters for reserve units
examples: Guards patrol the armory where weapons are securely stored
The medieval castle's armory contained swords, shields, and crossbows
The National Guard unit meets weekly at the local armory
The old armory was converted into a community recreation center

definitions: hollow area under the arm at the shoulder where arm joins torso
examples: The doctor checked for swollen lymph nodes in her armpit
He applied deodorant to his armpits after showering thoroughly

definitions: organized military land force equipped for fighting on land
large number of people or things organized for a particular purpose
examples: The army deployed thousands of troops to the conflict zone
She enlisted in the army straight after high school graduation
An army of volunteers helped clean up after the hurricane
The company hired an army of consultants to fix problems

definitions: distinctive and typically pleasant smell, especially of food, wine, or coffee
examples: The aroma of fresh bread filled the bakery each morning
Coffee's rich aroma woke her before the alarm clock

definitions: state of being awake, alert, or mentally stimulated
state of sexual excitement or physiological readiness for sexual activity
examples: Caffeine increases arousal and improves concentration in most people
The loud noise caused immediate arousal from deep sleep
Physical arousal involves increased heart rate and blood flow
Psychological factors significantly influence sexual arousal in humans

definitions: way things are organized or positioned in relation to each other
adaptation of a musical composition for different instruments or voices
informal agreement or settlement between parties about how something will happen
examples: The florist created a stunning arrangement of roses and lilies
The seating arrangement placed family members at separate tables
The jazz arrangement of the classical piece sounded completely fresh
She wrote new arrangements for the school choir's performance
They made arrangements to meet at the restaurant later
The divorce arrangement gave joint custody to both parents

definitions: person who adapts musical compositions for different instruments or performers
person who organizes or arranges things, especially events or agreements
examples: The arranger transformed the pop song into an orchestral masterpiece
Jazz arrangers often create unique interpretations of standard songs
The wedding arranger coordinated all vendors and scheduling details
She worked as a travel arranger for corporate executives

definitions: ordered series or arrangement of things in rows or columns
impressive display or range of a particular type of thing
data structure storing elements of the same type in computer programming
examples: Solar panels formed an array across the entire rooftop
The telescope array detected signals from deep space
The store offered an impressive array of imported cheeses
An array of options confronted the committee members
Initialize the array with ten integer values starting at zero
The program stores user data in a two-dimensional array

definitions: act of seizing and detaining someone by legal authority
sudden cessation or stopping of a process, movement, or development
examples: Police made several arrests during the protest downtown yesterday
The arrest warrant was issued after evidence surfaced unexpectedly
Doctors worked to arrest the spread of infection quickly
The drug arrests cell division in cancerous tissue effectively
